com.wegas.reviewing.ejb

Class ReviewingFacade

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wegas.reviewing.ejb.ReviewingFacade

  • public class ReviewingFacade
extends Object
    PeerReview EJB Facade Contains PeerReviewing logic
    Author:
    Maxence Laurent (maxence.laurent at gmail.com)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close(Long peerReviewDescriptorId)
      Reviewing phase is over -> author will be able to see feedbacks
      void close(PeerReviewDescriptor prd)
      The Reviewing will be completely finished after closing
      void descriptorRevivedEvent(DescriptorRevivedEvent event)
      Since PeerReviewDescriptor toReview variable is only referenced by its own private name on the JSON side, we have to resolve those name to effective VariableDescriptor Moreover, as the variable may not yet exists (especially when posting a whole GameModel) when the PeerReviewDescriptor is created, we'll have to wait to resolve such identifier.
      void dispatch(Long peerReviewDescriptorId)
      Called by the teacher, it will take each PeerReviewInstance matching the given peer review descriptor and dispatch them (who review who?)

      • submitReview

        public Review submitReview(Review review)
        Submitting a review occurs twice in the whole process First time when the reviewer post his review. In this case, the review switch from DISPATCHED to REVIEWED. The second time is when the author post his comments, switch from NOTIFIED to COMPLETED
        Parameters:
        review - the review to submit
        Returns:
        review

        Returns:

      • descriptorRevivedEvent

        public void descriptorRevivedEvent(@Observes
                                   DescriptorRevivedEvent event)
        Since PeerReviewDescriptor toReview variable is only referenced by its own private name on the JSON side, we have to resolve those name to effective VariableDescriptor Moreover, as the variable may not yet exists (especially when posting a whole GameModel) when the PeerReviewDescriptor is created, we'll have to wait to resolve such identifier. This is done by listening to DescriptorRevivedEvent
        Parameters:
        event -
